				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.74%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:14.42%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;2
223&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Finished goods primarily include product ready for shipment
 as well as promotional merchandise held for sale. Raw materials primarily include ingredients
 concentrate and packaging.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Inventories&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consist of raw materials and finished goods and are stated at the lower of cost or market and include adjustments for estimated obsolete or excess inventory. Cost is based on actual cost on a first-in first-out basis. Raw materials that will be used in production in the next twelve months are recorded in inventory. The provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are based on estimated forecasted usage of inventories. A significant change in demand for certain products as compared to forecasted amounts may result in recording additional provisions for obsolete inventory. Provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are recorded as cost of goods sold. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-indent: -36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;7. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 27pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Lease Obligations&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In June 2011
 we entered into an office building sublease for use as our principal headquarters. The term of the sublease is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years with an option to extend for up to three additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year terms. Under the terms of the sublease
 we received a rent abatement period and a build out allowance that is being amortized over &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years
 the initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year term plus one additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year renewal period
 which is the reasonably assured rental period given the economic consequences of an earlier move. The resulting deferred rent of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;425
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 is included in Deferred &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;r&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ent
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;current portion and Long-term liabilities &amp;#x2013; other &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets. During the initial term
 there is an annual rent escalation which we would expect to continue in the renewal periods.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Also
 under the terms
 we were required to deliver a Letter of Credit (LOC) issued by KeyBank National Association for a portion of the Subtenant Improvement Allowance (as defined in the sublease agreement)
 or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;183
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 which will be released after year three of the sublease term
 provided we have not been late in the payment of rent more than five times during such period. As a condition of and to secure the LOC
 KeyBank National Association required us to place &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;183
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; in an interest bearing restricted reserve account
 invested in a certificate of deposit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. This amount was reclassified in 2013 from Other assets to Prepaid expenses and other current assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Our &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;scheduled payments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the remainder of the initial sublease term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; were as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:26.26%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;127&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:68.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.38%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the years &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we incurred&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; rental expenses of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;213
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$214
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Fixed assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Fixed assets are recorded at cost less accumulated depreciation and depreciated on the declining balance basis over the estimated useful lives of the assets as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:56.72%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:41.28%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:56.72%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:8pt;&gt;Asset&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Reclassification&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;A reclassification of Licensing revenue to Revenue has been made to the prior year balances to conform to the current year presentation.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Revenue recognition&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 delivery has occurred
 the sales price is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured. Revenue is recorded net of provisions for discounts
 slotting fees and promotion allowances. For the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 our revenue was reduced by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;respectively
 for slotting fees and promotion allowances. All sales to distributors and customers are final; however
 in limited instances
 due to product quality issues or distributor terminations
 we may accept returned product. To date
 such returns have not been material.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:24pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

Sales are assigned to geographic locations based on the location of customers. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The 2012 revenue is being presented to conform with 2013 presentation in consideration with licensing reclassifications&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.  respectively of revenues.&lt;/font&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:25.96%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$3.00&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$3.99&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.72%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Shipping and handling costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Shipping and handling amounts paid to us by customers are included in revenue and total &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;305
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;342
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. The actual costs of shipping and handling paid by us are included in cost of sales.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table style=width:100%; cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td valign=top align=left style=width: 18.00pt; display: inline;&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;;&gt; 1.&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:18pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:18pt;width:18pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td align=left valign=top&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Nature of Operations and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Jones Soda Co. develops
 produces
 markets and distributes premium beverages which we sell and distribute primarily in North America through our network of independent distributors located throughout the U.S. and Canada and directly to our national and regional retail accounts.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We are a Washington corporation and have two operating subsidiaries
 Jones Soda Co. (USA) Inc. and Jones Soda (Canada) Inc. (Subsidiaries).&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Basis of presentation and consolidation&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAP) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) rules and regulations applicable to financial reporting. The consolidated financial statements include our accounts and accounts of our wholly owned subsidiaries. All intercompany transactions between us and our subsidiaries have been eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Liquidity &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we had cash and cash-equivalents of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 and working capital of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;3.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. Cash used in operations during fiscal years &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$317
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. Our cash flows vary throughout the year based on seasonality. We traditionally use more cash in the first half of the year as we build inventory to support our historically seasonally-stronger shipping months of April through September
 and expect cash used by operating activities to decrease in the second half of the year as we collect receivables generated during our stronger shipping months.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 net cash provided by investing activities totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$40
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; due primarily to the sale of fixed assets. For the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 net cash provided by investing activities totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$61
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; due primarily to the sale of fixed assets
 partially offset by the purchase of fixed assets. Net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$61
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; primarily from warrant exercises
 offset by our capital lease payments. This compares to net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 which totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 from the net proceeds from our registered offering in February 2012. We incurred a net loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. Our accumulated deficit increased to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$58.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; compared to the prior year&amp;#x2019;s deficit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$56.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of the date of this Report
 we believe that our current cash and cash equivalents will be sufficient to meet our anticipated cash needs through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December&amp;nbsp;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. Additionally
 our Loan Facility (described below)
 is available for our working capital needs. Beginning in 2012
 we made significant reduction in operating expenses and personnel
 primarily in the second half of 2012
 to better align our operations with available capital and slow our cash used in operations. We continued these reduced operating expenses through 2013. As a result
 our &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;total cash used in operations for the year was $317
000
 a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million improvement compared to 2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. We believe that these cost controls and realigned expenses are strategically important to further the Company's long-term viability. However
 these significant cost containment measures may negatively impact our sales and may make it difficult to achieve top-line growth.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;On &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December&amp;nbsp;27
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we entered into a secured credit facility (Loan Facility) with BFI Business Finance (BFI)
 replacing our prior loan facility. The Loan Facility allows us to borrow a maximum aggregate amount of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 subject to satisfaction of certain conditions. Under this Loan Facility
 we may periodically request advances equal to the lesser of: (a)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 or (b) the Borrowing Base which is the sum of and in the following priority (i) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;85%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of eligible U.S. accounts receivable
 plus (ii) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;35%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of finished goods inventory not to exceed &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;300
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 plus (iii) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of eligible Canadian accounts receivable not to exceed &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$300
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 subject to any reserve amount established by BFI. Annual interest on unpaid advances under the Loan Facility is equal to the Prime Rate plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 where Prime may not be less than &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 and a monthly loan fee of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; will be payable to BFI monthly on the daily loan balance. The Loan Facility has an initial term of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; year which automatically extends for successive &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year terms unless either party gives at least &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; days' prior written notice of its intent to terminate the Loan Facility at the end of the then current term. BFI has the right to terminate the Loan Facility upon &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;120&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; days&amp;#x2019; prior written notice. Our obligations under the Loan Facility are secured by a first priority security interest in all of the assets of the Company and Subsidiaries. We may use the Loan Facility for our working capital needs. As of the date of this Report
 we have not drawn on the facility.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the year ended December 31
 2013
 we received $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;105
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; from the cash exercise of certain outstanding warrants. We may receive cash through the exercise of the remaining balance of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;3
057
500&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; warrants outstanding. However
 we cannot predict the timing or amount of cash proceeds we may receive from exercise
 if at all
 of any of the other outstanding warrants. We do not consider the potential for future cash exercises of the warrants as a dependable source of financing for the Company.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We may require additional financing to support our working capital needs in the future. The amount of additional capital we may require
 the timing of our capital needs and the availability of financing to fund those needs will depend on a number of factors
 including our strategic initiatives and operating plans
 the performance of our business and the market conditions for debt or equity financing. Additionally
 the amount of capital required will depend on our ability to meet our case sales goals and otherwise successfully execute our operating plan. We believe it is imperative to meet these sales objectives in order to lessen our reliance on external financing in the future. Part of our Turnaround Plan is to focus on core geographic markets and retail channels that are considered operating priorities and to redirect resources to support our distributor network through promotion allowances at retail. It is critical that we meet our case sales goals and increase case sales going forward
 as our operating plan already reflects prior significant cost containment measures and may make it difficult to achieve top-line growth if further significant reductions become necessary. We intend to continually monitor and adjust our business plan as necessary to respond to developments in our business
 our markets and the broader economy. Although we believe various debt and equity financing alternatives will be available to us to support our working capital needs
 financing arrangements on acceptable terms may not be available to us when needed. Additionally
 these alternatives may require significant cash payments for interest and other costs or could be highly dilutive to our existing shareholders. Any such financing alternatives may not provide us with sufficient funds to meet our long-term capital requirements. If necessary
 we may explore strategic transactions that we consider to be in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders
 which may include
 without limitation
 public or private offerings of debt or equity securities
 a rights offering
 and other strategic alternatives; however
 these options may not ultimately be available or feasible.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The uncertainties relating to our ability to successfully execute our &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Turnaround Plan
 combined with the difficult financing environment
 continue to raise substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern. Our audited financial statements for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December&amp;nbsp;31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; were prepared assuming we would continue as a going concern
 which contemplates that we will continue in operation for the foreseeable future and will be able to realize assets and settle liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. These financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classifications of liabilities that could result should we be unable to continue as a going concern.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:14pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Use of estimates&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:24pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The preparation of the consolidated financial statements requires management to make a number of estimates and assumptions relating to the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Significant items subject to such estimates and assumptions include
 but are not limited to
 inventory valuation
 depreciable lives and valuation of capital assets
 valuation allowances for receivables
 trade promotion liabilities
 stock-based compensation expense
 valuation allowance for deferred income tax assets
 contingencies
 and forecasts supporting the going concern assumption and related disclosures. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:24pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We consider all highly liquid short-term investments with an original or remaining maturity of three months or less at the date of purchase to be cash equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:14pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Fair value of financial instruments&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:24pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The carrying amounts for cash and cash equivalents
 receivables and payables approximate fair value due to the short-term maturity of these instruments. The carrying value of other long-term liabilities approximated fair values because the underlying interest rates approximate market rates at the balance sheet dates.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Accounts receivable&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Our accounts receivable balance includes balances from trade sales to distributors and retail customers. The allowance for doubtful accounts is our best estimate of the amount of probable credit losses in our existing accounts receivable. We determine the allowance for doubtful accounts based primarily on historical write-off experience. Account balances that are deemed uncollectible
 are charged off against the allowance after all means of collection have been exhausted and the potential for recovery is considered remote. Allowances for doubtful accounts of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;42&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;93&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 are netted against accounts receivable. Activity in the allowance for doubtful accounts consists of the following for the years ended December 31 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Net charges to bad debt expense &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.32%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.74%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:14.46%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;(19)
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.32%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Inventories&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consist of raw materials and finished goods and are stated at the lower of cost or market and include adjustments for estimated obsolete or excess inventory. Cost is based on actual cost on a first-in first-out basis. Raw materials that will be used in production in the next twelve months are recorded in inventory. The provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are based on estimated forecasted usage of inventories. A significant change in demand for certain products as compared to forecasted amounts may result in recording additional provisions for obsolete inventory. Provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are recorded as cost of goods sold. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Fixed assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Fixed assets are recorded at cost less accumulated depreciation and depreciated on the declining balance basis over the estimated useful lives of the assets as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;tr&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;30%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Leasehold improvements &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Equipment under capital lease &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Lease term which approximates its useful life&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Impairment of long-lived assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Long-lived assets
 which include capital and intangible assets
 are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of the assets to future undiscounted net cash flows expected to be generated by the assets. If such assets are considered to be impaired
 the impairment to be recognized is measured by the amount by which the carrying amount of the assets exceeds the fair value of the assets. The fair value of the assets is estimated using the higher of discounted future cash flows of the assets or estimated net realizable value. Long-lived assets are grouped at the lowest level for which there are identifiable cash flows when evaluating for impairment. Assets to be disposed of are reported at the lower of the carrying amount or fair value less costs to sell. There are no unamortized intangible assets as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Foreign currency translation&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The functional currency of our Canadian subsidiary is the Canadian dollar. We translate assets and liabilities related to these operations to U.S.&amp;nbsp;dollars at the exchange rate in effect at the date of the consolidated balance sheet; we convert revenues and expenses into U.S.&amp;nbsp;dollars using the average monthly exchange rates. Translation gains and losses are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Revenue recognition&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 delivery has occurred
 the sales price is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured. Revenue is recorded net of provisions for discounts
 slotting fees and promotion allowances. For the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 our revenue was reduced by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;respectively
 for slotting fees and promotion allowances. All sales to distributors and customers are final; however
 in limited instances
 due to product quality issues or distributor terminations
 we may accept returned product. To date
 such returns have not been material.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Shipping and handling costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Shipping and handling amounts paid to us by customers are included in revenue and total &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;305
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;342
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. The actual costs of shipping and handling paid by us are included in cost of sales.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Advertising costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Advertising costs
 which also include promotions and sponsorships
 are expensed as incurred. During the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we incurred advertising costs of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;415
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$779
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Income taxes&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We account for income taxes by recognizing the amount of taxes payable for the current year and deferred tax assets and liabilities for future tax consequences of events at enacted tax rates that have been recognized in our financial statements or tax returns. We perform periodic evaluations of recorded tax assets and liabilities and maintain a valuation allowance
 if considered necessary. The determination of taxes payable for the current year includes estimates. We believe that we have appropriate support for the income tax positions taken
 and to be taken
 on our tax returns and that our accruals for tax liabilities are adequate for all open years based on an assessment of many factors including past experience and interpretations of tax law applied to the facts of each matter. No reserves for an uncertain income tax position have been recorded for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Net loss per share&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Basic net loss per share is computed using the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the periods
 excluding reacquired stock and common stock held in escrow that is subject to cancellation if certain criteria are not achieved. Diluted earnings per share is computed by adjusting the weighted average number of common shares by the effective net exercise or conversion of all dilutive securities. In &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 due to the net loss
 all outstanding equity options and warrants are anti-dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Comprehensive loss&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Comprehensive loss is comprised of net loss and other adjustments
 including items such as non-U.S.&amp;nbsp;currency translation adjustments. We do not provide income taxes on currency translation adjustments
 as the historical earnings from our Canadian subsidiary is considered to be indefinitely reinvested.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Seasonality&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Our&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; sales are seasonal and we experience fluctuations in quarterly results as a result of many factors. We historically have generated a greater percentage of our revenues during the warm weather months of April through September. Timing of customer purchases will vary each year and sales can be expected to shift from one quarter to another. As a result
 management believes that period-to-period comparisons of results of operations are not necessarily meaningful and should not be relied upon as any indication of future performance or results expected for the fiscal year.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Reclassification&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;A reclassification of Licensing revenue to Revenue has been made to the prior year balances to conform to the current year presentation.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-indent: -36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;9.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 30pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Shareholders&amp;#x2019; Equity&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Under the terms of our 2011 Incentive Plan (Plan)
 the number of shares authorized under the Plan may be increased each January 1st by an amount equal to the least of (a) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1
300
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares
 (b) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of our outstanding common stock as of the end of our immediately preceding fiscal year
 and (c) a lesser amount determined by the Board of Directors (the Board)
 provided that the number of shares that may be granted pursuant to awards in a single year may not exceed &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of our outstanding shares of common stock on a fully diluted basis as of the end of the immediately preceding fiscal year. Effective January 1
 2013
 the total number of shares of common stock authorized under the Plan increased &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;to&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;5
584
032&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Under the terms of the Plan
 the Board may grant awards to employees
 officers
 directors
 consultants
 agents
 advisors and independent contractors. Awards may consist of stock options
 stock appreciation rights
 stock awards
 restricted stock
 stock units
 performance awards or other stock or cash-based awards. Stock options are granted at the closing price of our stock on the date of grant
 and generally have a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year term and vest over a period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;48&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; months&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; with the first &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;25.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; cliff vesting &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; year&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; from the grant date and monthly thereafter. As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 there were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1
773
016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares of unissued common stock authorized and available for future awards under the Plan.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table style=width:100%; cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td valign=top align=left style=width: 18.00pt; display: inline;&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;;&gt; (a)&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td align=left valign=top&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

154
112&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.26%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.70%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:15.00%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;1.49&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:63.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;On &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;August&amp;nbsp;6
 2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 the Board of Directors granted options for the purchase of a total of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares of common stock under the Plan to our new Chief Executive Officer with an exercise price and grant date fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.29&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.23&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. The first option grant is for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares and was fully vested upon grant. The second option is for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares to vest over time subject to her continued employment
 with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; vested on &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;June&amp;nbsp;27
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and the remaining balance vesting on &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;June&amp;nbsp;27
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:14.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:47.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Non-vested restricted stock at December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:18.12%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#x2014;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:13.94%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#x2014;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:14.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#x2014;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;There were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;sh&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ares&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; withheld by the Company for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt 18pt;text-indent: -18pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;(c)&amp;nbsp;Stock-based compensation expense:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Stock-based compensation expense is recognized using the straight-line attribution method over the employees&amp;#x2019; requisite service period. We recognize compensation expense for only the portion of stock options or restricted stock expected to vest. Therefore
 we apply estimated forfeiture rates that are derived from historical employee termination behavior. If the actual number of forfeitures differs from those estimated by management
 additional adjustments to stock-based compensation expense may be required in future periods.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we had unrecognized compensation expense related to stock options of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;313
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to be recognized over a weighted-average period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;years. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 all prior awards of restricted stock had vested
 and we had &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; unrecognized compensation expense related to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;non&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-vested restricted stock. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The following table summarizes the stock-based compensation expense (in thousands): &lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We employ the following key weighted-average assumptions in determining the fair value of stock options
 using the Black-Scholes option pricing model and the simplified method to estimate the expected term of &amp;#x201C;plain vanilla&amp;#x201D; options:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.42%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.08%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.56%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:12.96%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;0.25&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 no material modifications were made to outstanding stock options. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The aggregate intrinsic value of stock options outstanding at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;226
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;10
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and for options exercisable was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;387
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;10
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. The intrinsic value of outstanding and exercisable stock options is calculated as the quoted market price of the stock at the balance sheet date less the exercise price of the option. The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;7
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. There was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; intrinsic value of restricted stock vested during the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table style=width:100%; cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td valign=top align=left style=width: 18.00pt; display: inline;&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;;&gt; (d)&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td align=left valign=top&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Employee Stock Purchase Plan:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In May 2007
 our shareholders approved our 2007 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) which allows eligible employees to acquire shares of our common stock at a discount. The ESPP includes &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;300
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;shares available for issuance
 and no amounts have been issued under the ESPP through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Accounts receivable&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Our accounts receivable balance includes balances from trade sales to distributors and retail customers. The allowance for doubtful accounts is our best estimate of the amount of probable credit losses in our existing accounts receivable. We determine the allowance for doubtful accounts based primarily on historical write-off experience. Account balances that are deemed uncollectible
 are charged off against the allowance after all means of collection have been exhausted and the potential for recovery is considered remote. Allowances for doubtful accounts of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;42&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;93&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 are netted against accounts receivable. Activity in the allowance for doubtful accounts consists of the following for the years ended December 31 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:14pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Use of estimates&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:24pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The preparation of the consolidated financial statements requires management to make a number of estimates and assumptions relating to the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Significant items subject to such estimates and assumptions include
 but are not limited to
 inventory valuation
 depreciable lives and valuation of capital assets
 valuation allowances for receivables
 trade promotion liabilities
 stock-based compensation expense
 valuation allowance for deferred income tax assets
 contingencies
 and forecasts supporting the going concern assumption and related disclosures. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
